intro: Eleocharis albovaginata, commonly known as the white sheath sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. The plant has slender, grass-like stems and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are usually white or pale green, giving it its distinctive appearance. Eleocharis albovaginata plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
